title: EventBasedpHShift_WMRS

pH_beginning.title: pH_beginning
pH_beginning.description: The initial pH, prior to the start of the reaction, should be specified.

pH_after_event.title: pH_after_event
pH_after_event.description: The pH that is present after a specific event has occurred.

event_description.title: event_description
event_description.description: Information regarding the event that caused the pH change. In the case of a fed-batch reaction protocol, this event can also be the planned adjustment of the pH value to another specific value based on     the current progress of the reaction process.

pH_at_XY.title: pH_at_XY
pH_at_XY.description: The pH can also be measured at a variably chosen time point

time_at_XY.title: time_at_XY
time_at_XY.description: Specification of the exact time point

time_unit.title: time_unit
time_unit.description: Common units for specifying time can be s (seconds) or min (minutes).

detected_when.title: detected_when
detected_when.description: Specification whether all components of the reaction solution were already present or if some were added after the measurement at the timepoint of the pH measurement.

detected_how.title: detected_how
detected_how.description: The pH value of a reaction can be determined in various ways, such as using a pH meter, pH paper, titration, electrochemical sensors, or other methods.

temperature.title: temperature
temperature.description: The temperature at the time of pH measurement.

temperature_unit.title: temperature_unit
temperature_unit.description: The temperature can be specified in units such as K, °C, or °F.

calibration_pH_electrode.title: calibration_pH_electrode
calibration_pH_electrode.description: Usually, a pH electrode is calibrated using standard buffers at 20-25 °C. If the conditions in the reaction mixture differ from this, it should be specified. (

special_treatment.title: special_treatment
special_treatment.description: If there are any other specific methods, procedures, characteristics or aspects related to the pH value that are important for reproducibility and are not described by the aforementioned                    metadata, they should be explained here.

description: If the pH is changed during the course of the reaction or there is an event-based change, this must be documented precisely. Depending on the buffer chosen, a temperature shift may also result in a pH shift.
